Key Match Events: Indiana broke a 56-all halftime tie with the first five points of the second half and used a pivotal 40-point third quarter to seize control.
Indiana never trailed in the second half.
Post-Match Reflections: Indiana has finally started playing the way it envisioned over these past 11 games. Haliburton is in sync, the defense has improved and the Pacers have won eight times during that span to reach.500.
Coach Mike Budenholzer is waiting for career win No. 500.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Indiana had 35 assists on 46 baskets and only six turnovers while outrebounding the Suns 47-37.
The Pacers swept the two-game season series from Phoenix.
Others: Tyrese Haliburton did not commit a turnover for the second straight game.
